definitions.definition: Any one of the flat surfaces cut into a gem.
definitions.example: This facet of the diamond was masterfully cut to enhance its value.

definitions.definition: One among many similar or related, yet still distinct things.
definitions.example: The child's learning disability was only one facet of the problems contributing to his delinquency.

definitions.definition: One of a series of things, such as steps in a project.
definitions.example: We had just about completed the research facet of the project when the order came to cancel it.

definitions.definition: One member of a compound eye, as found in insects and crustaceans.

definitions.example: the articular facet of a bone

definitions.definition: Any of the small joints at each segment of the spine that provide stability and help guide motion
The narrow plane surface between flutings of a column.
A face of codimension 1 of a polytope.
A criterion that can be used to sort and filter, such as the colour or size of products in an online store.
To cut a facet into a gemstone.
